headline.main: CALL BY PRESIDENT; He Says Post-War Unity Is 'Supreme Necessity' to Bar a New War AND KEEP WORLD PEACE United Nations Must Remain Together for Common Planning, Executive Asserts ROOSEVELT ASKS POST-WAR UNITY

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 -- On the first anniversary of the signing of the compact by the United Nations, President Roosevelt asserted today that "the unity thus achieved amidst dire danger has borne rich fruit" in that the United Nations were now passing from the defensive to the offensive, and declared that when the war was won it would continue the common effort to maintain and safeguard the peace.
abstract: United Nations Declaration: Roosevelt anniv statement
